newsitem.title: UK: AirRep to base two AN-12s at Kent International.
newsitem.headline: AirRep to base two AN-12s at Kent International.

text.p: AirRep said it will permanently base a 20 tonnes capacity Antonov AN-12 at Manston's Kent International Airport from May 30.
This move follows AirRep's appointment as UK, Ireland and Scandinavia general sales agent for for Bulgarian freight airline, Inter Trans Air, of Sofia it added in a statement.
A second Antonov AN 12 is due to be based at Kent International Airport during June.
The Bulgarian-crewed aircraft have Western avionics and are virtually self-handling. They are available for ad hoc or long-term charter in Europe and North Africa, it added.
AirRep commercial director, Lynn Vaughan told Reuters that they had only begun to advertise the AN-12 on Friday and "lots of enquiries had already come in."

These included flying East African perishables from Duesseldorf three times a week to the UK market and also moving construction equipment ex-UK to Jakarta, she said. --Reuters Air Cargo Newsroom Tel+44 171 542-7706 Fax+5017
